intro: Kitagawia terebinthacea, commonly known as the Chinese terebinth, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has some traditional medicinal uses in Chinese herbal medicine.
